articles.title: Apple Stock’s Resilience Means This Is an Opportunity, Says BofA. Plus, Meta, Occidental, and More.
articles.content: RESEARCH REPORTS These reports, excerpted and edited by Barron’s, were issued recently by investment and research firms. The reports are a sampling of analysts’ thinking; they should not be considered the views or recommendations of Barron’s.

articles.title: Apple Leads Magnificent 7 Stocks Higher Friday to Cap Off Volatile Week
articles.content: Apple shares surged Friday, leading other Magnificent Seven members higher amid a broader market rebound to cap off a wild week fueled by tariff-driven volatility.

articles.title: Apple has 50% chance of getting tariff exemptions, analyst says
articles.content: Apple (AAPL) is in focus as a tech company heavily impacted by President Trump's tariffs on imports from China. CFRA Research senior equity analyst Angelo Zino joins Market Domination Overtime to discuss the iPhone maker's position. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

articles.title: Why the Zacks Rank is More Important Than Ever
articles.content: Following the Zacks Rank will allow investors to see which stocks are navigating a tariff-induced economic slowdown effectively as the Trump administration has implemented the highest tariffs on imports in over a century.

articles.title: Apple’s China-Centric Supply Chain, Once Its Greatest Asset, Is Now a Liability

articles.title: Art Is in a Bear Market. A Trade War Won’t Help.

articles.title: Apple's Supply Chain Strength
articles.content: Tony Wang, manager of T. Rowe Price's Science & Technology Equity Strategy portfolio, explains why Apple is still the portfolio's biggest holding despite US-China tariffs. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Technology."

articles.title: Jim Cramer on Apple (AAPL): “What is the Most Hurt Stock? Apple. Are Those Just Fools Buying It?”
articles.content: We recently published a list of Jim Cramer Questions Market Logic and Dissects These 7 Key Stocks. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Apple Inc. articles.title: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: JPMorgan, Wells Fargo, Texas Instruments, Newmont, Apple, Nvidia, Tesla, and More
articles.content: JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, and Morgan Stanley post better-than-expected earnings, while Apple and Nvidia trade higher even as the U.S.-China trade war intensifies.
